sources.title: The Capture
sources.description: An American working for an oil company in Mexico shoots a man suspected of stealing the payroll; later, he fears that the man was innocent.

sources.title: The Capture (1950) NEW HD RESTORATIONüçï WESTERN NOIR
sources.description:
üçïNEW HD RESTORATIONüçï
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: Lew Ayres, Teresa Wright, Victor Jory, Duncan Renaldo 
Director: John Sturges
Writer: Niven Busch

This Western-Noir mash-up follows Lew Ayres as an oilman whose fateful actions during a manhunt lead to life-altering consequences. Teresa Wright shines as a widow whose life becomes entwined with his as he seeks forgiveness and truth in the shadow of a moral dilemma. 

Directed by the legendary John Sturges and written by acclaimed novelist Niven Busch, this classic blends the suspense of film noir with the stark landscapes of the contemporary 1950s Southwest, delivering a tense, character-driven thriller.

If you love vintage Hollywood, the work of John Sturges, or timeless cinematic storytelling, The Capture is a true gem. Fans of Lew Ayres, Teresa Wright, and the golden age of cinema will appreciate this thrilling exploration of conscience and consequence.

Subscribe to PizzaFLIX for more HD restorations, rare classic films, and legendary performances that keep the magic of vintage cinema alive!

metadata.Plot: Badly injured and hunted by the police, Lin Vanner takes refuge in a priest's home, and tells him what has happened. When Vanner was working in a Mexican oil field, he captured a man who was suspected of a payroll robbery, but then felt responsible when the man died in police custody. As a result of the incident, Vanner's fianc√©e broke off their engagement, and he resigned from his job. He later felt compelled to visit the dead man's widow, and ended up working on her ranch. But, as he now explains to the priest, the past has quickly caught up with him.
metadata.Actors: Lew Ayres, Teresa Wright, Victor Jory
